alert.note: Alert for Hillsborough (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 28 at 9:51AM EDT until further notice by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Tampa Bay Ruskin FL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Florida... Withlacoochee At SR 200 Holder affecting Citrus County. ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Florida... Hillsborough River At Morris Bridge affecting Hillsborough County. .Heavy rainfall expected due to Hurricane Ian will lead to flooding across many area rivers. For the Withlacoochee...including US 301 Trilby, Croom, SR 200 Holder, US 41 Dunnellon...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Hillsborough...including Morris Bridge, Temple Terrace, Hillsborough River State Park...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Hillsborough River At Morris Bridge. * WHEN...From late Thursday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Portions of Morris Bridge road about 3/4 of a mile south of the bridge begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 27.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Friday morning and continue rising to 34.4 feet Saturday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 32.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 34.4 feet on 09/08/2004. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 am EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Sun Mon Hillsborough River Morris Bridge 32.0 27.9 Wed 9 am 29.4 32.3 34.4 35.0 34.9 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 100 AM EDT.
